attributes.action: open schools, colleges and universities to access education on site
attributes.additional_details:
Their future is important and to be secured to access education as normal to take their exams as opposed to the extremity of cancelled exams and down graded students below their predicted grades after all the hard work achieved to secure high grades.
In support of  mental health for the future generation to flourish we must safeguard the wellbeing of school children and young people to access education effectively on site to function in society and contribute to aid world economy in  moving forward.
attributes.background: covid19 vaccination is in operation on a wide scale and reported significantly reduced rate of infection. It is essential for the opening of schools, colleges and university lectures to take place as  lockdown is taking a huge toll on students mental health due to isolation pandemic to be lifted.

rejection.details:
From 8 March schools and colleges reopened to all students, as set out in the Government's Spring 2021 Covid-19 roadmap: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/covid-19-response-spring-2021/covid-19-response-spring-2021

Universities still remain closed to most students, and we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Set a date for when non-practical university students can return to campus: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577166
